node.title: Canterbury's Waimakariri River off-limits after oil spill from Kaiapoi factory fire
node.description: Early estimates are as much as 20,000 litres of oil could have been lost.
node.content: ["One of the biggest rivers in Canterbury is off-limits following an oil spill from a factory fire in Kaiapoi.", "Thousands of litres of quenching fluid has flowed out to sea through the Cam, Kaiapoi and Waimakariri rivers.", "A faint mist rains over the Sutton Tools factory in Kaiapoi - trying to keep dangerous particles from becoming airborne.", "Inside the charred remains are the holding tanks that were full of quenching fluid, much of which has spilled into nearby waterways.", "\"There was approximately 60,000 litres in the tanks on the site. Early estimates are indicting maybe a 20,000 litre loss of oil,\" says Environment Canterbury (ECan) coastal response and readiness lead Emma Parr.", "Whilst the clean up has seen 2000 litres of oil sucked out of nearby waterways, much of the spill is too far gone.", "The Cam and Kaiapoi Rivers link into one of Canterbury's largest, the Waimakiriri, and oil has washed through all three and out to sea.", "\"We're just recommending that you stay out of it until the weekend especially if you're seeing oil. If you can see it and smell it just stay away from it,\" Parr says.", "Fire tore through the Sutton Tools factory early on Sunday morning. Just one main building remains completely untouched, the rest razed to the ground in a mangled heap of likely contaminated material. The cause is still unknown.", "Fire investigators have been stood down while air quality tests are taken to determine if and when it's safe to go back in.", "The plant's nearly 100 employees won't be allowed back in for some time either whilst one of Kaiapoi's biggest employers ponders its next step."]
